meanings.definition: Power or energy, especially as a divine force in Hinduism.
meanings.sent1: The sakti of the sun gives us warmth and light.
meanings.sent2: She felt the sakti of nature all around her in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought it could control the sakti of the storm.
meanings.sent4: The sakti of music filled the room, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The sakti of love can heal even the deepest wounds.

meanings.definition: A type of martial arts in Indonesia.
meanings.sent1: He practiced sakti to improve his strength and agility.
meanings.sent2: The dojo was filled with students learning the art of sakti.
meanings.sent3: In the tournament, his opponent's sakti seemed unbeatable.
meanings.sent4: The sakti of the warrior was unmatched on the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: Her sakti training taught her discipline and focus.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional dance in Bali.
meanings.sent1: The graceful movements of the dancers showcased the beauty of sakti.
meanings.sent2: The festival was a celebration of culture, with sakti performances.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey tried to mimic the sakti of the dancers.
meanings.sent4: Her sakti on stage captivated the audience with its elegance.
meanings.sent5: The sakti of the music and dance transported the audience to another world.
